cards.title: Your thank you gift from your Marriott stay

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu automàtic de: Marriott Stay <msak@awsoponline.com>

I was walking through the park yesterday, the one with the big oak trees near the old fountain. The leaves are just starting to turn, you know, that hint of gold at the edges. I saw a man sitting on a bench, feeding pigeons from a small paper bag. He was wearing a tweed hat, the kind my grandfather used to wear. The pigeons gathered around his feet, cooing softly, pecking at the crumbs he tossed. It was a quiet scene, the kind that makes you slow down for a moment. I thought about how we rush past so many of these small moments every day. The sun was warm on my face, a gentle contrast to the cool breeze coming from the west. I continued my walk along the gravel path, past the rose garden which is mostly done for the season. A few late blooms held on, deep reds and fading pinks. I remembered reading a book once about the history of public gardens in the city. It talked about the landscape architects who designed them over a century ago, planting trees they knew they would never see fully grown. There's something hopeful in that, planning for a future you won't inhabit. Further along, a group of children were playing a game of tag, their laughter echoing. One of them had a bright blue balloon tied to their wrist. It bobbed along with their movements, a cheerful spot of color against the grey of the path. I sat on a different bench for a while, just watching the clouds drift. They were the fluffy cumulus type, moving slowly from one horizon to the other. A woman walked by with t

cards.title:
Curso de Inteligencia Artificial aplicada a Finanzas webinar 11 de
 febrero.

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu automàtic de: Escuela Internacional Finanzas <info@mensajesolution.com>

Buenos días,

Le informo del Curso de Inteligencia Artificial aplicada a
Finanzas, que se impartirá por webinar en directo el próximo 11
de febrero (8:30 a 14.30) (6 horas en directo más aula virtual)
(100% bonificable). El webinar es una videoconferencia
interactiva por internet. Si no puede asistir al directo, acceso
a la grabación durante un mes.

Este curso está diseñado para profesionales financieros de
las empresas interesados en comprender y aplicar herramientas de
IA en sus operaciones y estrategias. Se tratan los conceptos
fundamentales de la inteligencia artificial aplicados al entorno
financiero empresarial y se analizan casos reales y usos actuales
de la IA en departamentos financieros de empresas,
identificando herramientas y soluciones de IA que optimizan
funciones como la contabilidad, tesorería, planificación y
reporting.

Le adjunto enlace al temario y al boletín de inscripción,
por si fuera de su interés:

Más información:  click aquí 
( https://tr103463315.mensajesolution.com/c/q05p551/bacqhklm/jlancu1u1jw )


En este curso principalmente analizaremos:

1. Introducción a la IA

Integración de la IA en las finanzas de la empresa..

Tecnologías.

La IA y cómo afecta a las finanzas.

2. Práctica en las finanzas de empresa.

Automatizaciones.

Aplicación en presupuestos y costes.

Informes financieros automatizados.

Previsiones de tesorería.

3. Plataformas de IA que pueden utilizarse

Los ERP’s y la IA.

De: Luis Miguel Cruz López <lmcruz@radixanimacion.com>
Asunto: Para maquetar

¡Hola! A continuación adjunto más textos para maquetar.

También envío un layout con un reacomodo de secciones que hemos
hablado con Carolina.
Entre los temas más importantes están:
1) Artículo de monografics al inicio
2) Cada monografics tendrá una portadilla

Como notas adicionales:
1) La sección de conferencias tendrá un pequeño reacomodo
2) a índice de autores y anuncios les quitaremos una página, la final
dedicaremos a el logo de los 30 años de Animac por un lado y el cartel
del esta edición por el otro. Queremos que esto se pueda recortar para
coleccionar, de modo que sería importante dejar aire y poner el escudo
de las tijeras para que la gente sepa.
3) Nos gustaría poner fotos de ediciones anteriores en el texto de
Carolina, hablaremos con premsa para saber si tiene alguna.

Estamos a tus órdenes para cualquier duda o comentario.

-----

cards.title: If today feels like “fake it till you make it”...

descriptionBlocks.text:
Correu automàtic de: 
	Stephanie Schwab at Crackerjack Marketing <hello@crackerjackmarketing.com>

You’re not alone—and you’re not doing it wrong.Hi Nuria,

Can we normalize something real quick?

Even very capable, successful, smart leaders sometimes wake up and think: 

**“Do I actually know what I’m doing today?”**

(If you’ve never had that thought, congratulations…you are either fibbing or are a superhero!)

Confidence isn’t a straight line. It wobbles. Especially when you’re making big decisions, trying new things, or carrying a lot of responsibility on your shoulders.

And here’s the part no one loves to admit: Leadership doubt doesn’t always look like panic.

* Sometimes it looks like overthinking.

* Or procrastinating.

* Or second-guessing decisions you would’ve made easily six months ago.

What do you do when confidence feels a little… squishy?

Here are a few things I’ve learned (and remind myself of often):

**1) Step Back Before You Spiral**

Not every uncomfortable feeling means something is wrong. Sometimes it just means you’re stretching.

**2) Get Perspective, Not More Opinions**

There’s a difference between thoughtful input and crowd-sourced confusion. Choose a small circle of people who actually understand your business and your goals.

**3) Focus on What Is Working**

When confidence dips, our brains get very dramatic and forget every single win we’ve ever had. A quick reality check can be surprisingly grounding.

**4) Don’t Try to Carry Everything Alone**

This one’s big. Wobbly confidence often shows up when yo

Correu automàtic de: "Planning & Buying Awards" <shows@mediapost.com> 

Meet our Planning & Buying Award Judges of the Week

Some of the best and brightest creative media pros in the industry will be judging your submissions.

Chad is a scientist-turned-marketer, with a Ph.D. in Anthropology. His passion for the intersection of people, culture, and technology drives insights and helps build brands, businesses, and meaningful connections. At KSM Media, a leading independent agency in Chicago, he leads a team of over 100 professionals serving clients across the QSR, Entertainment, CPG, Financial Services, and Healthcare sectors. Chad’s focus is hunting for what’s next, future-proofing clients and the agency, and translating those innovations, insights, and ideas into awareness and revenue.  Read more about Chad Maxwell  here [https://www.mediapost.com/creativemediaawards/#jury].

Alison sets the bar for intellectual integrity and performance, as a results-driven leader who never flinches amid complex challenges. She'd rather play chess when most opt for checkers, setting up brands and agencies to leapfrog competition versus small wins with superior quality and outcomes.  As Founder + CEO of Eden Collective, Alison defines the strategic focus and drives client relationships. In five years, she has grown the firm fivefold, attracting top talent and establishing Eden Collective as a leader in paid media and measurement for the startup community. Three Days in the Desert with Top Leaders in Media Planning & BuyingMarch 18-21, 2026  Scottsdale, AZ      Register Now [https://events.mediapost.com/event/planningandbuying-scottsdale-2026/regProcessStep1]

Media planning has always been about finding connection in complexity, but today’s ecosystem is testing that skill like never before. With AI reshaping workflows, traditional search losing ground to agentic discovery, and audiences scattering across creators and nascent platforms, planners are rewriting the playbook in real time.

Join us as we explore how the industry’s most forward-thinking planners are building smarter, faster, and more connected strategies in a fractured and fragmented media landscape.

“The Summit reminds me how much I love marketing- our industry is ever-evolving and the creativity is endless.  I love the chance to meet the most intelligent and inspiring humans.”Kimberly Ito

Chief Marketing Officer at Mitsubishi Motors             ELITE MORNING CONTENT

MediaPost will produce dynamic morning content sessions and roundtables, with the brightest marketers in the business.

AFTERNOON ACTIVITIES

Planning & Buying Insiders will have the option of golfing, hiking, pool cabana hangouts and more.

EVENING COCKTAILS AND DINNERS

Our group will enjoy evenings together with a cocktail party and outdoor dining right in downtown Scottsdale.

We have built a community of Top Media Planners & Buyers who have come to our experiences including:

📩 NUEVO CORREO RELACIONADO:
De: David Curós <dcuros@turismegarrotxa.com>
Asunto: capes del mapa de mobilitat sostenible

Hola Alba,

La Montse Padrosa em comenta que el pdf que us vaig enviar no el
podíeu obrir amb l'Illustrator. Ja he vist què passa, quan genero el pdf
des del QGis ho posa tot en una sola capa, i hi ha tanta informació que
l'Illustrator no pot obrir-ho.

Per solucionar-ho us passo tants pdfs com capes tinc creades al projecte.
Te'ls adjunto, són 19 arxius.

Només haureu d'anar obrint cada pdf amb l'Illustrator, i guardar-los com a
capes del projecte.

Espero que així sí que funcioni!

Veuràs que de la capa "pein" te n'envio dues, i és que un cop les tinc
solapades, l'efecte de colors, transparències i línia de la vora de cada
polígon que em generen és el que busco. Però potser ho podeu resoldre en
una sola capa, això.

I la numeració segueix l'ordre que tinc al projecte, fixa't:
[image: imatge.png]


Cordialment,


*David Curós Vilanova*
Tècnic - Turisme Garrotxa
Tel. +34 972 27 16 00
dcuros@turismegarrotxa.com

<https://ohgarrotxa.com/area-professionals/...
